intro: Lightfootia diffusa var. stokoei, commonly known as the Stokoe's lightfootia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. It typically grows in wet, swampy areas and thrives in full sun to partial shade. The leaves are ovate and often have a velvety texture, adding to its ornamental appeal.
